item.title: EPA files complaint against Syngenta for farmworker safety violations on Kauai
item.description: HONOLULU – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has filed a complaint alleging that Syngenta Seeds, LLC violated numerous federal pesticide regulations meant to protect agricultural workers at its crop research farm in Kekaha, Kauai.
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: EPA settles with Pace International, LLC, over Clean Air Act violations on the Yakama Indian Reservation
item.description: (Seattle, WA - October 6, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has reached a settlement in a case against Pace International LLC, (Pace) of Wapato, WA, for federal Clean Air Act violations that occurred within the Yakama Indian Reservation.
item.dc:creator: Region 10

item.title: Colletton County Museum and Farmers Market to host Local Foods, Local Places Workshop
item.description: ATLANTA – The Colletton County Museum and Farmers Market in Walterboro, SC has been selected as one of several rural community projects across the country to participate in Local Foods, Local Places (LFLP), a federal initiative that helps communities increase economic opportunities for local farm
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Settlement with Owner of Fertilizer Plant in Culbertson, Neb., to Resolve Risk Management Program Issues
item.dc:creator: Region 07

item.title: FRIDAY: EPA and Mississippi Valley State University to Host Earth Day Program on Campus
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) together with Mississippi Valley State University (MVSU) will host a day-long Earth Day celebration on Friday, April 22, 2016.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Moves to Cancel the Insecticide Flubendiamide/Products cause risk to aquatic animals and environments manufacturers fail to comply with the terms of the registration
item.description: WASHINGTON -- The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is issuing a notice of intent to cancel all Bayer CropScience, LP and Nichino America, Inc., flubendiamide products that pose a risk to aquatic invertebrates that are important to the health of aquatic environments.
item.dc:creator: Headquarters, Chemical Safety and Pollution Prevention (OCSPP)
